كمان تخيل لو في عملية حسابية معقدة بتاخود وقت كبير جداً في المعالجة أكيد ده هيأثر على النظام , وأكيد هما عاملين حد لأقصى وقت لتنفيذ الكود كذا ثانية وخلاص. , كمان أكيد هما محددين مكتبات وفانكشنز معينة بس اللي تقدر تستخدمها لأني جربت اعمل Run لأكواد بتعمل UI حاجة بسيطة زي mbox اوJOptionPane  وماكنش بيقبلها فعلى ما اعتقد هما عاملين CustomParser لكل لغة بالWhite List Expressions اللي تقدر تنفذها عندهم ولو طلعت متوافقة يبعتها للكومبيلر بتاع اللغه بس اعتقد موضوع صعب ومتعب جداً , ياريت حد يقولنا ايه حلول المشاكل دي كفكرة عامة !

هو احد الحلول 
انك تخلي الباك اند تعمل كومبايل للكود عن طريق 
LLVM Compiler 
و تطلع 
LLVM Assembly Binary
then you can run the binary in your browser using 
LLVM.js
http://badassjs.com/post/39573969361/llvm-js-llvm-itself-compiled-to-javascript-via
طيب دى للحاجات الكومبايلد طيب والحاجات الinterpreted ؟ بايثون و روبى و php و كده ؟

الحاجات دي مش محتاجة security  لأن كل لغة من دول بتبقى شغالة في 
VM or Sandbox خاصة بيها
which take cares of security issues of your program.
هذا طبعا الله أعلى و أعلم :D
ايه حلول الSandBox اللى ممكن تعمل كده يا Ahmed Ibrahim Khalil  ؟

أنا مقلتش حلول SandBox
انا قلت ان مفيش قلق انك تعمل run لل interpreted languages
في الباك اند عشان كل لغة ليها ال VM or Sandbox الي بتاخد بالها من الحوار و بيبقى في layer ما بين your code and the underlying OS

ناخد أمثلة الي انت قلتها
Python - Is run by compilling the code into a bytecode format which is executed by the python VM.
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Python_%28programming_language%29#Implementations

Ruby- Is the same case as python uses a VM to execute code
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ruby_%28programming_language%29#Implementations

PHP - Same as Ruby and Python
http://stackoverflow.com/questions/3380581/does-php-have-a-virtual-machine-like-java

ممكن قد يكون في Special Cases for other languages
بس لحادة كدة 
My Knowledge Stops Here :P

I can still nuke your box with enough clever code obfuscation whether I'm an interpreted language running on top of a VM or not.
Also most interpreted languages can get statically compiled so it's more of an implementation detail than a language feature.
Only technology I'm strongly familiar with (I don't know everything) that have -debatably- decent sandboxing is the JVM and anything that goes on top of it. IIRC, you'll still need proper security policies in place not to mention a lot of control revoked on the system level.

Even then, running on an unprivileged user account you'd still be subject to privilege escalation exploits. 

With regards to memory allocation, process runtime and just about anything that could lead to a system DOS, *nix systems ship with a lot of tools for monitoring and limiting resources per processes so that'll come handy.

llvm.js is an overkill for the task at hand but a nice idea, eventually you'll end up doing a mix of a chrooted/jailed environment, if you wanna push it further then you'll put it inside  a lightweight container, I always recommend lxc.

Finally, depending on the target language and how much of its core is exposed, you can get your hands super dirty with meta programming and write your own sandboxing code.
I'll try to dig out some old nodejs code I wrote for this, but other technologies that come to mind are Erlang, Ruby (albeit will be a pain...), lisp (you'll love this), python, lua, c.
You'll be going along the lines of isolating the piece of code, treating it as data and executing it in a sandboxed process/thread with resource traps and limited context access (likely facades/proxies)

If I have time, I'll blog about implementing something like that.
Good luck.
